quoteFirst: "There isn't much more to tell," says the doctor, "except that I made a worse idiot of myself yet, and left McMakin about
quoteLast: in the afternoon, as near as I can recollect. Somewhere about ten o'clock that night I went home. Lucy was gone. I haven't seen her since.
title: Danny's Own Story
author: Marquis, Don, 1878-1937

quoteLast: the Captain asked the mate how we were getting on.

quoteFirst: The labor proved more difficult in consequence of a want of air, and it became necessary to put up ventilators. Sometimes the lamps would only burn in front of the air-pipe.
quoteLast: on the morning of the 14th, the voices of the imprisoned colliers could be heard. “There are three of us,” they said; and they gave their names.
title: The Underground World: A mirror of life below the surface

quoteFirst: He procured a number of hand-grenades, also rolls of port-fire, and canteens filled with inflammable materials, with contrivances to attach them to the side of the block-house. He set out with his troops early in the evening, and arrived within a mile of the block-house by
quoteLast: in the morning. The colonel gave Captain Black the command of about forty volunteers, who were first to approach. Twenty of them were to carry the port-fires, &c., &c.
title: Memoirs of Aaron Burr, Complete
author: Burr, Aaron, 1756-1836; Davis, Matthew L. (Matthew Livingston), 1773-1850 [Editor]

quoteFirst: From Grenada I intended to visit Yazoo City, and left for that purpose the next morning after my arrival, on the road to Troy, which place I reached about
quoteLast: . There I remained until the next morning, and was about resuming my journey, when a force of five regiments of cavalry made its appearance, coming in on the same road that I intended to take out. They passed through Troy, and took the direct road to Coffeeville.
title:
Four Years a Scout and Spy
"General Bunker", One of Lieut. General Grant's Most Daring and Successful Scouts, Being a Narrative of ... the Experience of Corporal Ruggles During Four Years' Service as a Scout and Spy for the Federal Army

quoteLast: . This is a village having a large public square and three fine churches. It is larger than Nopalucan, and must contain nearly four thousand inhabitants.

quoteFirst: And, as though, in throwing out this bill we had cast some trouble off our minds, we went on with the greater speed, bringing in true bills. About
quoteLast: we finished, and trooped down to the Court to be released.

quoteFirst: In households where the chief meal of the day is at one or
quoteLast: there is afternoon tea or coffee. It used invariably to be coffee, good hot coffee and fresh rusks and dainty little _Hörnchen_ and _Radankuchen_, an excellent light cake baked in a twisty tin.
title: Home Life in Germany
author: Sidgwick, Alfred, Mrs., 1854-1934

quoteLast: in the morning, Ben awoke shivering with cold. The damp night air, warm enough in the early evening, had chilled and aroused him. His restlessness startled Tommy who enquired what the matter was.
title: A tight squeeze
author: Staats, William

quoteFirst: Two days after Witherings' death, namely, on the 30th September 1651, by Order of Parliament, a previous Order of 21st March 1650, touching the office of Postmaster, inland and foreign, was revived, and the Council of State were directed to report their opinion thereon forthwith. On the 4th October, the Committee for the Posts pass an order, "that the Committee sit in the Inner Horse Chamber on Thursday,
quoteLast: , to receive the claims of all persons pretending any interest in the Foreign or Inland Letter Office, as also the propositions of any person about the improvement and management thereof." This invitation to claimants to come forward opened a very large door, as will be seen presently.
title: The Early History of the Post in Grant and Farm
author: Hyde, James Wilson, 1841-1918

quoteLast: in the morning, and I had to walk home, not a vehicle being attainable. I did not know my way to my headquarters, and I had no friend to go with me, but I fastened on a stray gentleman, who proved to be an ex-member of the House, and who accompanied me to 17 Dover Street, where I sought my bed with a satisfying sense of having done a good day's work and having been well paid for it.
title: Complete Project Gutenberg Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr. Works
author: Holmes, Oliver Wendell, 1809-1894

quoteLast: , we rolled in and through the long city of splendor, wherein the living day still bloomed on. Gay people filled the streets; the balconies sent each other songs; on the roofs bloomed flowers and trees between lamps, and the little bells of the hours prolonged the day; and the moon seemed to give warmth. Only now and then a man lay sleeping between the colonnades, as if he were taking his siesta.
title: Titan: A Romance. v. 2 (of 2)
author: Jean Paul, 1763-1825; Brooks, Charles Timothy, 1813-1883 [Translator]

quoteFirst: Consequently he enjoyed presenting neckties to his friends. His biographer, Slason Thompson, who worked in the same newspaper office, separated only by a low thin partition, relates that in the afternoon about
quoteLast: Field would stick his head above the partition and say,--"Come along, Nompy, and I'll buy you a new necktie," and when Thompson would decline the offer, Field would mildly respond, "Very well, if you won't let me buy you a necktie, you must buy me a lunch," and off to the coffee-house they would march, where the bill would be paid by Thompson, for Field was indeed through life the gay knight he styled himself, _sans peur and sans monnaie_.
title: Stories of Authors, British and American
author: Chubb, Edwin Watts, 1865-1959

quoteFirst: The co-operating land forces, under General Butler, had almost completely invested the fort, and the communication between it and Wilmington was at one time interrupted, so that it was impossible to ascertain the condition of affairs below. In the midst of the turmoil, we cast off from the wharf, about
quoteLast: of December 26th, and anchored off Smithville after dark, the tide not serving for crossing the bar that night.
title: The Narrative of a Blockade-Runner
author: Wilkinson, J. (John), 1821-1891

quoteFirst: "He accompanied me through the dim hall as far as the stairs. A short whirr from the old clock, and two hollow strokes were heard.
quoteLast: already! I waved my hand again, and went up-stairs, with how heavy a heart God only knows!
title: A Sister's Love: A Novel
author: Heimburg, W., 1850-1912; Waterman, Margaret Payson, -1926 [Translator]

quoteFirst: 23d.—To my great joy I entered the gates of Soccatoo in the afternoon, about
quoteLast: , after a tedious and wearisome journey of nearly a month. Not having seen my master for three months, I hastened to his house; but not finding him at home, I went to the Gadado’s, where, I was told, he had gone.
title: Journal of a second expedition into the interior of Africa, from the Bight of Benin to Soccatoo
author: Clapperton, Hugh, 1788-1827; Salamé, Abraham V. [Contributor]; Barrow, John, Sir, 1764-1848 [Contributor]; Clapperton, Samuel [Contributor]; Lander, Richard, 1804-1834 [Contributor]

quoteFirst: At this time Montgelas was in the sick ward of the prison for solitary confinement. On 10 April Eichinger went to the prison office to examine the files in the Montgelas case, whereupon the director of Nuernberg prison informed me confidentially that Count Montgelas had been summoned before the court martial on 5 April
quoteLast: , sentenced to death, and shot the next day. The crime for which Count Montgelas had been shot consisted of remarks made by him in a private room in the Grand Hotel to a lady, Mrs. Pfleger, of Bamberg.
title: Trials of war criminals before the Nuernberg military tribunals under control council law no. 10, volume III
author: Various

quoteFirst: It was a contingency for which he had not mentally provided. Here he stood, a stranger,
quoteLast: in the morning, in the presence of a young and lovely girl whose eyes had never rested on his face. What on earth was he to do?
title: The Mystery of M. Felix
author: Farjeon, B. L. (Benjamin Leopold), 1833-1903
